item.title: John Cleese – How about Russian?
item.description: Lermontov The words he speaks are from Молитва (Prayer), a short poem (1839) by Mikhail Lermontov . He starts (at 0:29) with the second stanza (Есть сила благодатная, в созвучьи слов живых) and continues with the first one – which Wanda cannot know, and apparently, it doesn’t matter much either.

item.title: Hidden treasures: Kladmen (The Dropman)
item.description: Searching and finding The kladman often has to search as well. For suitable and always new places and ways to hide the goods. In such a way that they can be found by those looking, without being seen by those who don’t know.

item.title: Nina Brodskaya – January Storm
item.description: Not easy (нелегко), not easy to love on this planet (нелегко полюбить на ней). Passing Each Other By January’s snowstorm rings (звенит январская вьюга) and the rain lashes down hard (и ливни хлещут упруго). Stars race in circles (звёзды мчатся по кругу) and the city noise (шумят города).

item.title: Love Love Love: all you need is Ljoebov
item.description: By Sandhya Daisy Sundaram IMDb , Vimeo That ‘Sundance-winning’ refers to this award at a Sundance Institute . There is also a short (2 m) Making Of. Read: ‘Love. Love. Love.’ in Russian winters (Russia Beyond, 2014).

item.title: Learn Russian with Films (1)
item.description: Short Films with Subtitles Short films require little time or effort. The R1 playlist Short Movies collects (and continues to add) short films with subtitles. Almost everything is under half an hour; the shortest, Мужика хочу , is just 1 minute and 20 seconds, while Не повезло / Bad Luck is a rare 47-minute exception.

item.title: State Funeral
item.description: Monty Pythonesque, reported de Volkskrant , but close to historical reality. Quite high praise for a film featuring supposed Russians speaking English. State Funeral Much more interesting and far closer to historical reality is State Funeral (2019, in Russian Государственные Похороны), by Ukrainian director Sergei Loznitsa .
